articles.title: Zelenskiy says he is ready to work on US-backed plan to end war in Ukraine
articles.summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy, after meeting a top U.S. Army official, expressed readiness to collaborate with Washington on a plan to end the war. Zelenskiy anticipates discussing this further with President Biden. This engagement highlights ongoing high-level diplomatic efforts between Kyiv and Washington to formulate a joint strategy for a peaceful resolution to the prolonged conflict in Ukraine.

articles.title: India–France defence ties deepen with joint R&D framework across advanced technologies

This collaboration aims to leverage cooperation in defence research and armaments development. Such partnerships bolster India's defence manufacturing capabilities, foster technological exchange with key international allies, and strengthen national security by ensuring access to advanced defence technologies.

articles.title: Missing Endangered Person Alert issued for Wisconsin woman last seen in May 2025, concern for well-being
articles.summary: Officials in Beaver Dam, Wisconsin, USA, have issued a Missing Endangered Person Alert for a 42-year-old woman. She was reportedly last in contact with family in May 2025. This alert indicates serious concerns for her immediate safety and well-being, prompting authorities to seek urgent public assistance in locating the individual amidst the challenging circumstances.

articles.title: Tom Brady and Birmingham unveil plans for new 62,000-seater stadium
articles.summary: Birmingham City Football Club has unveiled plans for an ambitious 62,000-seat stadium, set to be the focal point of a massive urban redevelopment project in Bordesley Green. This initiative extends beyond sports, aiming to revitalise the area's infrastructure and economy. Such large-scale infrastructure and urban planning projects are crucial for national development and showcase significant regional investment.

This backing persists despite critics raising concerns over its immense price tag and potential US stability issues. The deal, a cornerstone for Australia's future defence capabilities and regional security strategy, signifies a major international collaboration that politicians continue to advocate for.

It signifies continued growth and recognition for professional women's football in the United States.

articles.title: News 11/21/25
articles.summary: Ruthia He, CEO of the ADHD-prescribing platform Done, has been convicted on federal charges. These include illegally distributing Adderall, committing healthcare claims fraud, and conspiring to obstruct justice. This case underscores the vital importance of legal and ethical compliance in business, particularly within the healthcare technology sector, serving as a reminder of the serious consequences of corporate misconduct.

articles.title: All 7 DCU Superheroes, Ranked By Threat Level

The search was reportedly initiated due to alleged links of the publication to a secessionist plot. articles.title: Talk to Centre to stop harassment of Kashmiris across India, Mehbooba urges Omar
articles.summary: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti has urged NC Vice President Omar Abdullah to engage the central government regarding reports of harassment and profiling of Kashmiris across India. Mufti highlighted concerns over alleged discrimination faced by Kashmiri individuals in various parts of the country, emphasizing the need for immediate intervention to ensure their safety and prevent further marginalization.

articles.title: Russia's alleged hybrid warfare targeting seafloor cables vital to modern life

These critical infrastructures, spanning ocean floors, are vital for international connectivity, economic stability, and national security. Their immense strategic importance makes them potential targets, underscoring the need for robust protection and resilience planning in modern defence strategies.

articles.title: DAVE THE DIVER now available for Xbox Series and Xbox One; physical edition announced for PS5 and Switch 2

articles.title: China Defends Venezuela, Demanding U.S. Replace Anti-Drug Efforts with 'Normal' Policing

During a press briefing, Beijing demanded Washington cease involvement, emphasizing respect for Venezuela's sovereignty. This action highlights ongoing diplomatic friction between China and the US over geopolitical influence in Latin America, an important point for understanding global power dynamics.

articles.title: India needs to adopt next-gen technologies for human spaceflight missions: Shubanshu Shukla
articles.summary: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, India's second astronaut, emphasized India's critical need to rapidly adopt next-generation space technologies. He advocated for advanced solutions such as touch-screen spacecraft controls and sophisticated life support systems. This technological push is vital for bolstering India's space capabilities, fostering self-reliance, and ensuring a competitive edge in global space exploration, aligning with national progress and future strategic importance.

articles.title: Australia's naval nuclear propulsion: AUKUS update to IAEA Board of Governors, November 2025
articles.summary: Australia, the UK, and the US addressed an international body, likely the IAEA, acknowledging the Director General's latest report on Australia's naval nuclear propulsion program. This refers to the AUKUS security pact, under which Australia is acquiring nuclear-powered submarines with UK/US assistance, emphasizing adherence to non-proliferation standards and the development of this significant defence capability.

articles.title: IN PICTURES: Bundeswehr soldiers storm a Berlin U-bahn station
articles.summary: German army soldiers conducted a realistic urban warfare training exercise in Berlin's metro system on Wednesday. The drill involved navigating underground tunnels and reaching passenger trains, simulating operations within complex urban environments and critical infrastructure. This exercise enhances troop readiness for security challenges in densely populated areas, a crucial aspect of modern defence strategies.

This engaging interaction offers a glimpse into sports personalities' camaraderie and candid discussions beyond the field.

articles.title: Navy places ₹1,400-cr orders with start-ups, MSMEs to boost indigenous innovation
articles.summary: The Indian Navy has issued procurement orders totaling ₹1,400 crore to 16 start-ups and MSMEs since 2018. This strategic initiative aims to significantly strengthen India's maritime capabilities and accelerate self-reliance (Aatmanirbharta) in the defence sector. It underscores the Navy's commitment to integrating indigenous innovation, boosting national security through domestic industry development, a crucial step for aspirants to note.

articles.title: San Diego County police agencies access many private license plate readers with minimal oversight
articles.summary: Las Americas Premium Outlets has deployed discreet black cameras at its entrances to monitor vehicles. These systems capture the license plate, make, and model of every car entering the parking lot. This widespread adoption of surveillance technology for data collection by commercial entities raises considerations regarding privacy and the extent of monitoring in public-private spaces.
